comment.body:
I just did a test without any AdGuard products / services being installed or used.

Microsoft Edge with Norton Safe Web, Malwarebytes Browser Guard, LanguageTool, Video DownloadHelper, and uBlock Origin (all default lists, Ublock Annoyances, all security lists enabled), CleanBrowsing DNS Adult Filter, and I was able to log in without any problems.

comment.body:
Unfortunately, I cannot reproduce it.
Please try to disable-enable content blockers in Safari settings, restart Safari and check for filters update.
Do not close AdGuard app until filters will be updated.

If issue will still occurs then try to add this rule:
```adblock
everybump.com.au##a[href^="https://t.cfjump.com/"][target="_blank"] > img
```
to user rules.

issue.title: youtube.com: URL tracking
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

.

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed analytics or tracker

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

`https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pAZWv8QQ8Co`

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard URL Tracking filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

YouTube's description links have tracking parameters.

Example:
`https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pAZWv8QQ8Co`

In the description:
`https://www.youtube.com/redirect?event=video_description&redir_token=[...]&q=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.paypal.me%2Fpaysyfr&v=pAZWv8QQ8Co`

`event`, `redir_token`, `q` being the destination link and `v` being the video id.

Proposed filters for AdGuard URL Tracking Protection:
```adb
||youtube.com/redirect?$removeparam=event
||youtube.com/redirect?$removeparam=redir_token
||youtube.com/redirect?$removeparam=v
```

Result link:
`https://www.youtube.com/redirect?q=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.paypal.me%2Fpaysyfr`

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: Maybe good for only My Filters Tab or User Rules (`.../pages/options.html#user-filter`) tab/Filter (apps may have list named as Filter - similar to legacy interface of ABP) due links will always ask to confirm redirect.

issue.title: youtube.com: URL tracking
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

.

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed analytics or tracker

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

`https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pAZWv8QQ8Co`

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard URL Tracking filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

YouTube's description links have tracking parameters.

Example:
`https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pAZWv8QQ8Co`

In the description:
`https://www.youtube.com/redirect?event=video_description&redir_token=[...]&q=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.paypal.me%2Fpaysyfr&v=pAZWv8QQ8Co`

`event`, `redir_token`, `q` being the destination link and `v` being the video id.

Proposed filters for AdGuard URL Tracking Protection:
```adb
||youtube.com/redirect?$removeparam=event
||youtube.com/redirect?$removeparam=redir_token
||youtube.com/redirect?$removeparam=v
```

Result link:
`https://www.youtube.com/redirect?q=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.paypal.me%2Fpaysyfr`

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
I'm not sure if these rules should be added as it causes that there is necessary to confirm redirection.
There was issue about confirming redirection (caused by `$cookie` rule) here - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/128041#issuecomment-1229174825 and related comment - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/128041#issuecomment-1237773494 (and comments below).
So I guess that it's not user friendly and there will be similar reports.

@Alex-302 Could you please take a look at this issue when you come back from vacation?

issue.title: youtube.com: URL tracking
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

.

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed analytics or tracker

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

`https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pAZWv8QQ8Co`

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard URL Tracking filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

YouTube's description links have tracking parameters.

Example:
`https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pAZWv8QQ8Co`

In the description:
`https://www.youtube.com/redirect?event=video_description&redir_token=[...]&q=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.paypal.me%2Fpaysyfr&v=pAZWv8QQ8Co`

`event`, `redir_token`, `q` being the destination link and `v` being the video id.

Proposed filters for AdGuard URL Tracking Protection:
```adb
||youtube.com/redirect?$removeparam=event
||youtube.com/redirect?$removeparam=redir_token
||youtube.com/redirect?$removeparam=v
```

Result link:
`https://www.youtube.com/redirect?q=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.paypal.me%2Fpaysyfr`

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
Worse if every day people start complaining and "you" have to paste them a link to the solution:

> - disable Filter "URL tracking"
> or
> - add this to AdGuard's own rules / my filters in uBO: 
> ```adb
> ||youtube.com/redirect?$removeparam=event,badfilter
> ||youtube.com/redirect?$removeparam=redir_token,badfilter
> ||youtube.com/redirect?$removeparam=v,badfilter
> ```

These clicker can be used in scams:

```adb
[path="/redirect?q="]www.youtube.com#%#//scriptlet('trusted-click-element', '#invalid-token-redirect-goto-site-button', '', '500')
```

comment.body:
Niby starcza aktywacja IDCAC, bo mają `/cookiespopup/*`.

Można więc przepisać to na filtry kompatybilne z ABP i content blokerami.

Jakby zaczęli randomizować nazwę pliku to pewnie trzeba potestować różne bajery na walkę z colorboksem:

https://github.com/FiltersHeroes/PolishAnnoyanceFilters/issues/1324

być może ktoś nawet wymyśli w miarę stabilny skryptlet na cookies i te newsletery jak przetrwały do 2023.

Fixed for this case, but in general I'm not sure if we should add rules for those kind of websites.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://democlub.clubexpress.com/content.aspx?page_id=15&club_id=245449](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdemoclub.clubexpress.com%2Fcontent.aspx%3Fpage_id%3D15%26club_id%3D245449) ### Comment Username: `@mvestuto` > Log into a sample website at https://democlub.clubexpress.com/content.aspx?page_id=15&club_id=245449 > using the credentials: > msmith/hello > and then click on the control panel link located at the top of the site > > This is the "control panel" of the site which uses the same code as other websites on our platform. Each of the sections in screenshot 1 should be populated with icons. (Admin functions, website modules, setup). > > These links have the class "cpicon" which is being blocked by the base filter. > > This rule in the base filter class is too generalized and is causing the websites on our platform to be affected. Please make this rule less generic, or target whatever class is intended more carefully. I would prefer not to rewrite our entire control panel to work around your plugin. ### Screenshots

comment.body:
Hi.
We need to know the source site. If redirect or opening of new tab is random, probably your system or browser is infected by [adware](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/adware)
Please scan your system using an antivirus. Also check for suspicious extensions in your browser settings.

issue.title: www.torrentmac.net executing suspicious script loading CPU
issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [X] Browser version is up-to-date; - [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard for Mac ### AdGuard version 2.9.2.1234 release ### What type of problem have you encountered? Dangerous site ### Which browser(s) do you use? Firefox, Chrome, Safari ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? www.torrentmac.net ### What filters do you have enabled? AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Russian filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard DNS filter, Filter unblocking search ads and self-promotion ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? Send Do-Not-Track signals ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. Suspicious script which loads cpu is executed 2. Screenshots
Screenshot 1:
Screenshot 2:
When surfing the site or trying to download a torrent file suspicious js script executes and load cpu. May be some kind of hidden mining. AdGuard doesn't block it. Looks like disabling AdGuard protection makes it even worse. Adding `www.torrentmac.net$$script[tag-content="split"]` or `www.torrentmac.net#%#//scriptlet("abort-current-inline-script", "String.fromCharCode")` to user rules seems to resolve the problem. ### Privacy - [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
I couldn't reproduce high CPU usage, but I have added rules which I hope will fix this issue.
Filters update should be available in 1-2 hours.

Adding `www.torrentmac.net$$script[tag-content="split"]` or `www.torrentmac.net#%#//scriptlet("abort-current-inline-script", "String.fromCharCode")` to user rules seems to resolve the problem. ### Privacy - [X] I agree to follow this condition

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

1.46.1rc0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.pornfelix.com/

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard German filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, EasyList, EasyList Germany, EasyPrivacy

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. https://github.com/easylist/easylist/issues/14954#issuecomment-1427779014
 https://github.com/easylist/easylistgermany/issues/250#issuecomment-1428437004

A reason why to hide at least the bottom big ad placeholder is already provided: "annoying, taking space", thus it should be fixed, otherwise a counter-argumentation why not to fix it should be provided, "no because no"/ "ignoring" is insufficient explanation.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

<!-- # Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [ ] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [ ] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

Example: <https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/100000>

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
This issue does not happen with uBlock Origin (all default filters, all malware filters, uBlock Origin Annoyances), so Easy Privacy works without issue, but AdGuard Tracking Protection does not.

Even though I am currently not using AdGuard at this time, I just wanted to add that in case you ever decide to deal with this issue, good luck.
